blog.name: poniesbeforebronies
blog.title: Ponies and more!
blog.description:
A multi-fandom blog. Primarily MLP of all generations, but also with some Pokemon, Classic Spyro and Minecraft mixed in.
I also like a lot of other things, although I can't promise consistent content for such. I am an artist and will attempt to upload fanart to this blog as well as photos of found merch of interest and my ponies.


This blog will never upload or reblog porn, content that is otherwise sexual, or gore. However reblogs may contain the odd swear word or so, and though I do my best, I cannot always vouch for those I reblog from. I'd say this blog is more PG than G. :p
Following this theme, I do not consent to interaction from NSFW/Kink/ddlg/cgl blogs.




For your searching and blocking convince, all fandom content will be tagged with the names of relating media and characters. Anything that falls outside of fandom stuff will be tagged "Not Fandom". Pony-esque things that aren't necessarily MLP will be tagged "Not A Real Pony" and/or "Fakie" when applicable. I also like real horses. Those are tagged "Real Horses."

If you decide to follow me and require any tags please let me know! It's not a problem at all and I will do it for you. c:

Tags for my content are currently "ArtByTheFanBlob" and "TheFanBlobTakesPics"! :)

summary: I did talk about this a little bit on Twitter but I wanted to talk about it here (and no this isn't an "attack" on Retsuko and...
body:
I did talk about this a little bit on Twitter but I wanted to talk about it here (and no this isn’t an “attack” on Retsuko and Haida as a ship).

But the thing is, I really like Haida’s design and character. I even like his, ‘punk rock’s like style (literally a guilty pleasure of mine💕) but I do have a few issues with his character in general. For one, since season 1 its been pretty obvious that he has a crush on Retsuko. Which you know I was happy with, because hey they would make a cute ship (and of course there is the fan Au of a metal/punk band as well which is all fun in fanon).

But when you get to season 2, I started to get very meh about his character and not actually caring all that much about him. Only because it continued this cycle of, his one-sided crush, getting jealous because she is dating someone else (And he is even willing to want to fight tanado physically), getting drunk over it, etc.. And to me that really did not help his character in any way whatsoever. He hasn’t has any real growth at all and was this just this guy who has a one-sided crush on his coworker and nothing more. Sure Haida did help Retusko with the Anai situation but it just came off as,“Now I can look really cool in front if my crush-” type of thing. But that to me is a drag on his character to me, and maybe that’s just me.

In season two they could have gone two ways with his character: One being that, he gets some type of growth to where Retsuko will see him more in a romantic type of light. Or Two, have a lesson on a person letting go of their crush even if its painful (I mean we got a lesson on Retsuko’s relationship with Tadano so I mean?? They literally could have gone down that route with Haida but didn’t). I mean Season two wasn’t a “bad” season I just wish, he would have something more to him. This is kinda why I’m not entirely sold on Retsuko and Haida as a ship overall. But this is just my opinion on it.

summary: I don’t get why people are saying Tadano was manipulative. Maybe he was unconsciously but lets be real, almost every episode...
body: I don’t get why people are saying Tadano was manipulative. Maybe he was unconsciously but lets be real, almost every episode Retsuko is always taking about quitting her job, getting married to a rich guy, and settling down. And the universe literally gave her Tadano. I just think Tadano gave his own opinion about marriage and it just didn’t line up with Retsuko’s. he even gave her the option to quit her job to get away from her boss and find out her real passions other than heavy metal. In the end marriageless life with Tadano wouldn’t have made her happy and even though I probably would have left with Tadano in a heartbeat I think she was true to herself and decided to leave Tadano for a life that she actually wants.

summary: Some of you get your activism notes through a game of telephone so i feel like i should explain something. Haida? Not a “Nice...
body:
Some of you get your activism notes through a game of telephone so i feel like i should explain something. Haida? Not a “Nice Guy”, not an “Incel”. He’s a friend. A REAL, honest friend who happens to have a crush on Retsuko.

How to tell he’s a friend: He doesn’t treat her differently whether she returns his feelings or not. He confessed, she didn’t feel the same, and he didn’t change how he acted. No being mad at her, no yelling, no guilting, no unfriending. He has other female friends he’s not crushing on, he doesn’t make misogynistic comments, he doesn’t doubt his women friends’/colleges’ competency but is there to help them and reach out for their help in return.

How to tell he’s not a “Nice Guy”: He never once tried to discourage Retsuko from dating the guys she did. WHICH HAS ONLY BEEN TWO, SO YOU OTHER FANS WHO THINK HAIDA IS SUFFERING AND SHAME RETSUKO FOR NOT JUST DATING HAIDA BECAUSE HE’S SAD: GROW UP. A guy being sad or wondering why he’s not “good enough”? Normal human (an….thro?) emotions that happen to everyone no matter the relationship. He never made his brief whiny comments to her or let her know he was jealous. You’re allowed to be depressed when your crush is with someone else as long as you don’t want to ruin their happiness. Haida never made that move. Only time he acted? When he thought Tadano was maybe making Retsuko unhappy. He thought about hurting him or threatening him, but Haida is a Good Boy and a Dork Baby so he didn’t. When did he? Only when Washimi and Gori and Retsuko herself asked for intervention. He still never touched Tadano. Dog Driver….had a good nap.

Most importantly? Haida still asked Tadano if he was okay after everything. Because being dumped must suck. Haida knows being alone sucks. He’s that genuinely nice. He didn’t enjoy another person’s sadness or think it was his gain. He also didn’t use that opportunity to take advantage of Retsuko’s emotional low and try his luck again. He’s. a. F R I E N D.

There. I hope we’ve all learned the difference between toxic and non-toxic people today. Emotions: Good, healthy. Using your emotions to act selfishly against others: Bad.

summary: POSSIBLY UNPOPULAR AGGRETSUKO OPINION-I legitimately think Haida should get over Retsuko.
title: POSSIBLY UNPOPULAR AGGRETSUKO OPINION-I legitimately think Haida should get over Retsuko.
body: I know, they look cute together, but its been canonically almost two years and the boy STILL hasn’t gotten over her despite her CLEAR rejection of him. Not to mention that after she got a boyfriend again, he repeated his self-destructive pattern of getting drunk and passing out in the street. You’re a grown-ass man Haida, get it together.

reblog.comment: I know, they look cute together, but its been canonically almost two years and the boy STILL hasn’t gotten over her despite her CLEAR rejection of him. Not to mention that after she got a boyfriend again, he repeated his self-destructive pattern of getting drunk and passing out in the street. You’re a grown-ass man Haida, get it together.

trail.content_raw: I know, they look cute together, but its been canonically almost two years and the boy STILL hasn’t gotten over her despite her CLEAR rejection of him. Not to mention that after she got a boyfriend again, he repeated his self-destructive pattern of getting drunk and passing out in the street. You’re a grown-ass man Haida, get it together.
trail.content: I know, they look cute together, but its been canonically almost two years and the boy STILL hasn’t gotten over her despite her CLEAR rejection of him. Not to mention that after she got a boyfriend again, he repeated his self-destructive pattern of getting drunk and passing out in the street. You’re a grown-ass man Haida, get it together.
